message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with non-adaptive group testing, which involves identifying a small set of infected individuals from a larger population using a test procedure that can test a group of individuals at once. This problem is related to information theory (cs.IT), as the goal is to identify the infected individuals with as few tests as possible. The paper also involves algorithmic and computational aspects (cs.DS), as it discusses the design of a test procedure and a polynomial time algorithm for identifying the infected individuals. The use of group testing also has connections to combinatorics and discrete mathematics (cs.DM), as well as machine learning and statistics (cs.LG) and social networks and information retrieval (cs.SI).
